alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 2:02AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PORTIONS OF CARBON AND MONROE COUNTIES... At 159 AM EST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from near Hawley to near Lairdsville. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Wind gusts over 30 mph are possible with this squall, with snow reducing visibility to less than one mile. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Jim Thorpe, Nesquehoning, Weatherly, Henryville, Werry Lake, Pocono Pines, Pocono Raceway, Lake Harmony, Skytop, Tannersville, Mountainhome, Alpine Mountain, Long Pond, Albrightsville, Sun Valley, Arrowhead Lake and Jonas. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 80 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 306. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. Use caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Quick changes in visibility and slick roads can lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
